intro: Andriapetalum reticulatum, commonly known as the netleaf andriaceae, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Andriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive net-like venation on its leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in mountainous regions.
